reasoning: Juvenile polyps are benign hamartomatous polyps occurring in 1-2% of children (prevalence ~1500 per 100k). Incidence of clinical detection approximately 50 per 100k person-years based on pediatric gastroenterology studies. Most solitary and sporadic, distinct from juvenile polyposis syndrome.
source: Hyer W et al. (2004). Juvenile polyposis syndrome. J Med Genet. 41(1):1-11
